channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: App protection policies overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Connect Intune account to managed Google Play account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect your Intune account to your Managed Google Play account.

item.title: Enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS direct enrollment - Apple Configurator-Setup Assistant - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Apple Configurator to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices with Setup Assistant.

item.title: Configure compliance policies with actions for noncompliance in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your compliance policies with one or more actions for noncompliance to protect devices and your organization from unprotected devices. Actions can remotely lock devices, send email or notifications to device users, and more.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Collect Diagnostics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to collect diagnostics with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Find lost devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Locate lost or stolen devices by using the locate device feature in Microsoft Intune. Get details on security and privacy information when using the locate device action.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned userless devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned userless devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Manage and secure devices overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get an overview of the concepts and features you should know when managing devices that access organization resources in Microsoft Intune. You can manage new and existing devices, including BYOD personal devices, check health compliance and view reports, configure device features, and secure devices using mobile threat solutions.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Disable Activation Lock - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune to disable Activation Lock on Apple devices.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned user-associated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned user-associated devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Enroll personal devices in Intune with Android Enterprise work profile management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for personal devices and bring-your-own-device scenarios using Android Enterprise work profile management.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Reset Passcode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to reset a passcode with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Sync - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the device sync remote action in Intune to apply policy, app, and configuration updates to managed devices.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Send Custom Notifications - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune to create and send custom notifications to users of iOS/iPadOS and Android devices.

item.title: Using Windows virtual machines with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the general guidelines for using Windows 10/11 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Use direct enrollment for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy and enroll macOS devices in Microsoft Intune using direct enrollment with Apple Configurator.

item.title: Deployment guide for Windows device management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Windows device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Protect devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Intune capabilities that can help you protect your devices and data against unauthorized access and other threats.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Lost Mode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enable Lost Mode in Microsoft Intune to remotely lock a lost or stolen iOS or iPadOS device and display a custom message and phone number on the lock screen.

item.title: Use Multi Admin Approval in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure Multi Admin Approval to protect your tenant against the use of compromised administrative accounts in Intune.

item.title: Remove SCEP or PKCS certificates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the actions that can remove, revoke, or leave untouched the certificates on a device that were provisioned by Intune certificate profiles. Actions include tasks to wipe or retire a managed device, to unenroll a device, manage the certificate profile assignment, and more.

item.title: Update Windows BIOS features using DFCI MDM policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Device Firmware Configuration Interface (DFCI) profile to manage UEFI settings in Microsoft Intune. To use DFCI profiles, create Microsoft Entra security groups, the Windows Autopilot deployment profile, and the Enrollment State Page profile.

item.title: Admin checklist for software updates on BYOD in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for BYOD and personally owned devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on personal devices on Android and iOS/iPadOS platforms.

item.title: Set up Apple device management in Intune for corporate-owned userless devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned userless iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Update Cellular Data Plan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to update the cellular data plan for iOS/iPadOS devices that support eSIM with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Move from Android device administrator to mobile application management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to set up mobile application management, an alternative option to Android device administrator that focuses on app protection and doesn't require device enrollment.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove User - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to remove a user from a Shared iPad with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Windows Holographic devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and complete different tasks on devices running Windows Holographic for Business and HoloLens. You can configure the Company Portal app, create a compliance policy, customize OMA-URI settings, deploy apps, categorize devices in groups, create profiles, restrict devices, enable software updates, set terms and conditions, configure VPN and Wi-Fi settings, and use Hello for Business.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Logout current user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the logout the current user from a Shared iPad with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Shutdown - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to shutdown Apple devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Enable eSIM data connections in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or use eSIM to get internet and data access using different data plans. In Intune, add or import activation codes, and then assign these activation codes using a configuration profile. You can also monitor the eSIM profiles and check the status of the eSIM-enabled devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Wipe - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to wipe, or factory reset, devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Automatically remove devices with cleanup rules - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune's device cleanup rules offer a simple, automated way to ensure that only actively managed devices remain visible in the admin center. Learn more about device cleanup rules and how to configure them.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Quick Scan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand Microsoft Defender quick scan with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: BitLocker Key Rotation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the BitLocker recovery key with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Actions – Wipe, Lock, Locate, and More - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Discover how to use Microsoft Intune to remotely manage, wipe, lock, restart, and secure Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, Windows, and ChromeOS devices. Learn about available remote actions, prerequisites, and bulk actions for IT admins.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A guide to managing iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: View device details with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View your device details, including operating systems, storage space, manufacturer, and model. Get a list of installed apps, check compliance policies, and set up TeamViewer with Microsoft Intune in Azure. Similar to viewing inventory of the devices you manage.

item.title: Manage devices with endpoint security in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Security Administrators can use the Endpoint Security node to view devices and manage them in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create Intune policies to configure and manage Windows LAPS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create policies to manage the Windows Local Administrator Policy Solution (LAPS) on Windows devices that enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Run Remediation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand remediations with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Apps and Configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how apps and configurations can be removed temporarily, then restored automatically or manually using the Remove apps and configuration device action with Intune.

item.title: Update your workloads to support cloud-native endpoints
item.description: To support hybrid and remote workers, convert or migrate your workloads to support cloud-native endpoints. This planning guide focuses on deploying apps and updates with Intune, moving from Group Policy Objects, and using Windows Autopilot.

item.title: Intune Remote Action: Rotate FileVault Recovery Key - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the FileVault recovery key with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Passcode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to remove a passcode with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Delete - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to delete devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: New Remote Assistance Session - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the the new remote assistance session action in Intune to offer support to your users.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Retire - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to retire device using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop multi-session with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop multi-session with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Overview of the Microsoft Intune MDM lifecycle - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Intune helps you manage devices through their lifecycle - from enrollment, through configuration, to eventual retirement.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Rotate local admin password - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the local admin password on Windows and macOS devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Play Lost Mode Sound - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Play lost device sound remote action in Microsoft Intune to trigger an audible alert on a lost, stolen, or misplaced device—helping users locate it quickly and securely.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Pause Config Refresh - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to temporarily pause policy enforcement on Windows 11 devices using Intune's Pause Config Refresh remote action to support troubleshooting and manual changes.

item.title: Configure email settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create an email device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune, and deploy this profile to Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows devices. Use email profiles to configure common email settings, including a Microsoft Exchange email server. Add authentication methods to connect to corporate email on devices you manage.

item.title: How to configure the Intune Company Portal apps, Company Portal website, and Intune app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can configure the Intune Company Portal apps, Company Portal website, and Intune app.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remote Lock - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the remote lock action in Microsoft Intune to lock a managed device that has a passcode or PIN.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Rename Device - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Rename device remote action in Microsoft Intune to update the device name shown in the admin center. Useful for standardizing naming conventions, managing shared devices, and improving inventory clarity.

item.title: Overview of Apple User Enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple User Enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune Remote Action: Deprovision - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to deprovision a chromeOS device with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Full Scan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand Microsoft Defender full scan with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use derived credentials for mobile devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a third-party partners derived credential as an authentication method for Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Autopilot Reset - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Autopilot reset with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Fresh Start - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Fresh Start to remove or uninstall apps with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Restart - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to restart managed devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned Macs into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Categorize devices into groups in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Categorize Intune-managed devices into groups for easier management in the admin center.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment for shared device mode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up Apple automated device enrollment for iOS/iPadOS devices in shared device mode, a feature of Microsoft Entra.

item.title: Set up enrollment for Android Enterprise fully managed devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment in Intune for devices using the Android Enterprise fully managed device management solution.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for iOS/iPadOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Use Remote Help to assist users authenticated by your organization. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: With the Remote Help app, provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app.

item.title: Use a PKCS certificate profile to provision devices with certificates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates with Microsoft Intune, work with root certificates and certificate templates, and use device configuration profiles for a PKCS Certificate.

item.title: Microsoft Intune documentation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about Microsoft Intune's unified endpoint management and security solutions.

item.title: Microsoft Intune product and capabilities documentation
item.description: Learn more about how Microsoft Intune products and capabilities can help you secure, deploy, and manage users, apps, and endpoint devices.

item.title: Configure feature updates policy for Windows devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and manage Intune policy for Windows feature updates. Configure and deploy policy to maintain the Windows feature version of Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Bulk enrollment for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a bulk enrollment package for Microsoft Intune

item.title: Endpoint management services and solutions at Microsoft
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a family of on-premises products and cloud services. It includes Intune, Configuration Manager, co-management, Endpoint Analytics, Windows Autopilot, and the admin center to manage cloud devices and on on-premises.

item.title: Monitor results of your device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the device compliance dashboard to understand overall device compliance the per policy and per setting device compliance results.

item.title: Use Intune Suite add-on capabilities - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune Suite unifies a series of mission-critical advanced endpoint management and security capabilities. The capabilities of the suite are integrated with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Security across endpoint platforms for both cloud and on-premises co-managed devices.

item.title: Create a Windows Health Monitoring profile in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a Windows Health Monitoring profile to collect endpoint analytics and software update events on Windows 10/11 devices in Microsoft Intune. Use this data to recommend software, review startup performance, and fix support issues.

item.title: What is Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune manages users and devices, simplifies app management and automated policy deployment, and integrates with mobile threat defense. It connects to Managed Google Play, Apple tokens and certificates, and Teamviewer for remote assistance. Can use MDM or MAM to protect data, configure devices, and simplify access to company resources.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Use Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrator to standard user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the steps and phases for using Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrators to standard users.

item.title: Using Remote Help on macOS to assist authenticated users. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Remote Help to provide remote assistance to authenticated users and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: iOS/iPadOS app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Manage Apple volume-purchased apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, administrative templates (ADMX), and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog to configure administrative templates (ADMX) in Microsoft Intune on Windows 10/11 client devices. You can configure some Control Panel features, Start menu and task bar notifications, event log service, prevent IIS installation, and more.

item.title: Add Microsoft 365 Apps to Windows 10/11 devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on Windows 10/11 devices.

item.title: Assign apps to groups in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign an Intune app to groups of users or devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: App configuration policies for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use app configuration policies on an iOS/iPadOS or Android device in Microsoft Intune.
